</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We are including the following discussion to inform our existing and potential security holders generally of some of the risks and uncertainties that can affect our company and to take advantage of the "safe harbor" protection for forward-looking statements that applicable federal securities law affords.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	From time to time, our management or persons acting on our behalf may make forward-looking statements to inform existing and potential security holders about our company.&#160; All statements other than statements of historical facts included in this report regarding our financial position, business strategy, plans and objectives of management for future operations, industry conditions, and indebtedness covenant compliance are forward-looking statements.&#160; When used in this report, forward-looking statements are generally accompanied by terms or phrases such as "estimate," "project," "predict," "believe," "expect," "estimate," "continue," "anticipate," "target," "could," "plan," "intend," "seek," "goal," "will," "should," "may" or other words and similar expressions that convey the uncertainty of future events or outcomes.&#160; Items contemplating or making assumptions about, actual or potential future sales, market size, collaborations, and trends or operating results also constitute such forward-looking statements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">

</DIV>

Forward-looking statements speak only as of the date they are made.&#160; You should consider carefully the statements in "Item 1A. Risk Factors" and other sections of this report, which describe factors that could cause our actual results to differ from those set forth in the forward-looking statements.&#160; Our company does not undertake, and specifically disclaims, any obligation to update any forward-looking statements to reflect events or circumstances occurring after the date of such statements.

<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage3"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	GLOSSARY OF TERMS
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Unless otherwise indicated in this report, natural gas volumes are stated at the legal pressure base of the state or geographic area in which the reserves are located at 60 degrees Fahrenheit.&#160; Crude oil and natural gas equivalents are determined using the ratio of six Mcf of natural gas to one barrel of crude oil, condensate or natural gas liquids.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The following definitions shall apply to the technical terms used in this report.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<U>
	Terms used to describe quantities of crude oil and natural gas:
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Bbl
</FONT>
	."&#160; One stock tank barrel of 42 U.S. gallons liquid volume used herein in reference to crude oil, condensate or NGLs.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Boe
</FONT>
	."&#160; A barrel of oil equivalent and is a standard convention used to express oil, NGL and natural gas volumes on a comparable oil equivalent basis. Gas equivalents are determined under the relative energy content method by using the ratio of 6.0 Mcf of gas to 1.0 Bbl of oil or NGL.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Boepd.
</FONT>
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	Boe per day.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Btu or British Thermal Unit
</FONT>
	."&#160; The quantity of heat required to raise the temperature of one pound of water by one degree Fahrenheit.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	MBbl
</FONT>
	."&#160; One thousand barrels of crude oil, condensate or NGLs.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	MBoe
</FONT>
	."&#160; One thousand Boes.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Mcf
</FONT>
	."&#160; One thousand cubic feet of natural gas.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	MMBbl
</FONT>
	."&#160; One million barrels of crude oil, condensate or NGLs.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	MMBoe
</FONT>
	."&#160; One million Boes.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	MMBtu
</FONT>
	."&#160; One million British Thermal Units.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	MMcf
</FONT>
	."&#160; One million cubic feet of natural gas.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	NGLs
</FONT>
	."&#160; Natural gas liquids.&#160; Hydrocarbons found in natural gas that may be extracted as liquefied petroleum gas and natural gasoline.
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<U>
	Terms used to describe our interests in wells and acreage:
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Basin
</FONT>
	."&#160; A large natural depression on the earth's surface in which sediments generally brought by water accumulate.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Completion.
</FONT>
	"&#160; The process of treating a drilled well followed by the installation of permanent equipment for the production of crude oil, NGLs, and/or natural gas.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Conventional play.
</FONT>
	"&#160; An area that is believed to be capable of producing crude oil, NGLs, and natural gas occurring in discrete accumulations in structural and stratigraphic traps.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Developed acreage.
</FONT>
	"&#160; Acreage consisting of leased acres spaced or assignable to productive wells.&#160; Acreage included in spacing units of infill wells is classified as developed acreage at the time production commences from the initial well in the spacing unit.&#160; As such, the addition of an infill well does not have any impact on a company's amount of developed acreage.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	i
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage4"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Development well.
</FONT>
	"&#160; A well drilled within the proved area of a crude oil, NGL, or natural gas reservoir to the depth of stratigraphic horizon (rock layer or formation) noted to be productive for the purpose of extracting proved crude oil, NGL, or natural gas reserves.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Dry hole
</FONT>
	."&#160; A well found to be incapable of producing hydrocarbons in sufficient quantities such that proceeds from the sale of such production exceed production expenses and taxes.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Exploratory well.
</FONT>
	"&#160; A well drilled to find and produce crude oil, NGLs, or natural gas in an unproved area, to find a new reservoir in a field previously found to be producing crude oil, NGLs, or natural gas in another reservoir, or to extend a known reservoir.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Field
</FONT>
	."&#160; An area consisting of a single reservoir or multiple reservoirs all grouped on, or related to, the same individual geological structural feature or stratigraphic condition. The field name refers to the surface area, although it may refer to both the surface and the underground productive formations.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Formation
</FONT>
	."&#160; A layer of rock which has distinct characteristics that differs from nearby rock.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Gross acres or Gross wells.
</FONT>
	"&#160; The total acres or wells, as the case may be, in which a working interest is owned.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Held by operations.
</FONT>
	"&#160; A provision in an oil and gas lease that extends the stated term of the lease as long as drilling operations are ongoing on the property.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Held by production.
</FONT>
	"&#160; A
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	provision in an oil and gas lease that extends the stated term of the lease as long as the property produces a minimum quantity of crude oil, NGLs, and natural gas.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Hydraulic fracturing
</FONT>
	."&#160; The technique of improving a well's production or injection rates by pumping a mixture of fluids into the formation and rupturing the rock, creating an artificial channel. As part of this technique, sand or other material may also be injected into the formation to keep the channel open, so that fluids or natural gases may more easily flow through the formation.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Infill well.
</FONT>
	"&#160; A subsequent well drilled in an established spacing unit to the addition of an already established productive well in the spacing unit.&#160; Acreage on which infill wells are drilled is considered developed commencing with the initial productive well established in the spacing unit.&#160; As such, the addition of an infill well does not have any impact on a company's amount of developed acreage.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Net acres.
</FONT>
	"&#160; The percentage ownership of gross acres.&#160; Net acres are deemed to exist when the sum of fractional ownership working interests in gross acres equals one (e.g., a 10% working interest in a lease covering 640 gross acres is equivalent to 64 net acres).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Net well.
</FONT>
	"&#160; A well that is deemed to exist when the sum of fractional ownership working interests in gross wells equals one.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	NYMEX
</FONT>
	."&#160; The New York Mercantile Exchange.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	OPEC.
</FONT>
	"&#160; The Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Productive well
</FONT>
	."&#160; A well that is found to be capable of producing hydrocarbons in sufficient quantities such that proceeds from the sale of the production exceed production expenses and taxes.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Recompletion
</FONT>
	."&#160; The process of treating a drilled well followed by the installation of permanent equipment for the production of crude oil, NGLs or natural gas or, in the case of a dry hole, the reporting of abandonment to the appropriate agency.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	ii
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage5"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Reservoir
</FONT>
	."&#160; A porous and permeable underground formation containing a natural accumulation of producible crude oil, NGLs and/or natural gas that is confined by impermeable rock or water barriers and is separate from other reservoirs.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Spacing
</FONT>
	."&#160; The distance between wells producing from the same reservoir.&#160; Spacing is often expressed in terms of acres, e.g., 40-acre spacing, and is often established by regulatory agencies.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Unconventional play.
</FONT>
	"&#160; An area believed to be capable of producing crude oil, NGLs, and/or natural gas occurring in cumulations that are regionally extensive but require recently developed technologies to achieve profitability.&#160; These areas tend to have low permeability and may be closely associated with source rock as this is the case with crude oil and natural gas shale, tight crude oil and natural gas sands and coal bed methane.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Undeveloped acreage
</FONT>
	."&#160; Leased acreage on which wells have not been drilled or completed to a point that would permit the production of economic quantities of crude oil, NGLs, and natural gas, regardless of whether such acreage contains proved reserves.&#160; Undeveloped acreage includes net acres held by operations until a productive well is established in the spacing unit.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Unit
</FONT>
	."&#160; The joining of all or substantially all interests in a reservoir or field, rather than a single tract, to provide for development and operation without regard to separate property interests.&#160; Also, the area covered by a unitization agreement.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Wellbore
</FONT>
	."&#160; The hole drilled by the bit that is equipped for natural gas production on a completed well.&#160; Also called well or borehole.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	West Texas Intermediate or WTI.
</FONT>
	"&#160; A light, sweet blend of oil produced from the fields in West Texas.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Working interest
</FONT>
	."&#160; The right granted to the lessee of a property to explore for and to produce and own crude oil, NGLs, natural gas or other minerals. The working interest owners bear the exploration, development, and operating costs on either a cash, penalty, or carried basis.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<U>
	Terms used to assign a present value to or to classify our reserves:
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Possible reserves.
</FONT>
	"&#160; The additional reserves which analysis of geoscience and engineering data suggest are less likely to be recoverable than probable reserves.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Pre-tax PV-10% or PV-10.
</FONT>
	"&#160; The estimated future net revenue, discounted at a rate of 10% per annum, before income taxes and with no price or cost escalation or de-escalation in accordance with guidelines promulgated by the SEC.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Probable reserves.
</FONT>
	"&#160; The additional reserves which analysis of geoscience and engineering data indicate are less likely to be recovered than proved reserves but which together with proved reserves, are as likely as not to be recovered.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Proved developed producing reserves (PDP's).
</FONT>
	"&#160; Reserves that can be expected to be recovered through existing wells with existing equipment and operating methods.&#160; Additional crude oil, NGLs, and natural gas expected to be obtained through the application of fluid injection or other improved recovery techniques for supplementing the natural forces and mechanisms of primary recovery are included in "proved developed reserves" only after testing by a pilot project or after the operation of an installed program has confirmed through production response that increased recovery will be achieved.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Proved developed non-producing reserves (PDNP's).
</FONT>
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	Proved crude oil, NGLs, and natural gas reserves that are developed behind pipe, shut-in or that can be recovered through improved recovery only after the necessary equipment has been installed, or when the costs to do so are relatively minor.&#160; Shut-in reserves are expected to be recovered from (1) completion intervals which are open at the time of the estimate but which have not started producing, (2) wells that were shut-in for market conditions or pipeline connections, or (3) wells not capable of production for mechanical reasons. Behind-pipe reserves are expected to be recovered from zones in existing wells that will require additional completion work or future recompletion prior to the start of production.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	iii
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage6"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Proved reserves
</FONT>
	."&#160; The quantities of crude oil, NGLs and natural gas, which, by analysis of geosciences and engineering data, can be estimated with reasonable certainty to be economically producible, from a given date forward, from known reservoirs, and under existing economic conditions, operating methods, and government regulations, prior to the time at which contracts providing the right to operate expire, unless evidence indicates that renewal is reasonably certain, regardless of whether deterministic or probabilistic methods are used for the estimation.&#160; The project to extract the hydrocarbons must have commenced or the operator must be reasonably certain that it will commence the project within a reasonable time.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Proved undeveloped drilling location.
</FONT>
	"&#160; A site on which a development well can be drilled consistent with spacing rules for purposes of recovering proved undeveloped reserves.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Proved undeveloped reserves
</FONT>
	" or
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	PUDs
</FONT>
	."&#160; Reserves that are expected to be recovered from new wells on undrilled acreage, or from existing wells where a relatively major expenditure is required for development.&#160; Reserves on undrilled acreage are limited to those drilling units offsetting productive units that are reasonably certain of production when drilled.&#160; Proved reserves for other undrilled units are claimed only where it can be demonstrated with reasonable certainty that there is continuity of production from the existing productive formation.&#160; Estimates for proved undeveloped reserves will not be attributable to any acreage for which an application of fluid injection or other improved recovery technique is contemplated, unless such techniques have been proved effective by actual tests in the area and in the same reservoir or an analogous reservoir.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	(i)
</FONT>
<FONT ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 5.14PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	The area of the reservoir considered as proved includes: (A) the area identified by drilling and limited by fluid contacts, if any, and (B) adjacent undrilled portions of the reservoir that can, with reasonable certainty, be judged to be continuous with it and to contain economically producible crude oil, NGLs or natural gas on the basis of available geoscience and engineering data.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	(ii)
</FONT>
<FONT ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 5.14PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	In the absence of data on fluid contacts, proved quantities in a reservoir are limited by the lowest known hydrocarbons ("LKH") as seen in a well penetration unless geoscience, engineering, or performance data and reliable technology establishes a lower contact with reasonable certainty.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	(iii)
</FONT>
<FONT ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 5.14PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Where direct observation from well penetrations has defined a highest known oil ("HKO") elevation and the potential exists for an associated gas cap, proved oil reserves may be assigned in the structurally higher portions of the reservoir only if geoscience, engineering or performance data and reliable technology establish the higher contact with reasonable certainty.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	(iv)
</FONT>
<FONT ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 5.14PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Reserves which can be produced economically through application of improved recovery techniques (including, but not limited to, fluid injection) are included in the proved classification when: (A) successful testing by a pilot project in an area of the reservoir with properties no more favorable than in the reservoir as a whole, the operation of an installed program in the reservoir or an analogous reservoir, or other evidence using reliable technology establishes the reasonable certainty of the engineering analysis on which the project or program was based; and (B) the project has been approved for development by all necessary parties and entities, including governmental entities.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	(v)
</FONT>
<FONT ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 5.14PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	Existing economic conditions include prices and costs at which economic producibility from a reservoir is to be determined. The price shall be the average during the 12-month period prior to the ending date of the period covered by the report, determined as an unweighted arithmetic average of the first-day-of-the-month price for each month within such period, unless prices are defined by contractual arrangements, excluding escalations based on future conditions.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	"
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Standardized measure
</FONT>
	."&#160; The estimated future net revenue, discounted at a rate of 10% per annum, after income taxes and with no price or cost escalation, calculated in accordance with Accounting Standards Codification ("ASC") 932, formerly Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No. 69 "Disclosures About Oil and Gas Producing Activities."
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	iv
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage7"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	NORTHERN OIL AND GAS, INC.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">

<!--ANCHOR-->
</A>
	TABLE OF CONTENTS
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
<BR>
</FONT>
</FONT>
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<TABLE ID="B024D3EE258A4B79BF7A270A5FBD6680" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-COLLAPSE: COLLAPSE" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 11.48%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 72.87%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 15.65%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM: #000000 2PX SOLID">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Page
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP" COLSPAN="3">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Part I
</DIV>
</TD>

	ANNUAL REPORT ON FORM 10-K
</DIV>

	FOR FISCAL YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2015
</DIV>
<EFX_PART_I>
<A NAME="FIS_PART_I"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	PART I
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">

</DIV>
<EFX_BUSINESS>
<A NAME="FIS_BUSINESS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<A NAME="NOG10K_HTM_ITEM1_BUSINESS">
<!--ANCHOR-->
</A>
	Item 1.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Business
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Overview
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We are an independent energy company engaged in the acquisition, exploration, development and production of oil and natural gas properties, primarily in the Bakken and Three Forks formations within the Williston Basin in North Dakota and Montana.&#160; Our primary focus is oil exploration and production through non-operated working interests in wells drilled and completed in spacing units that include our acreage.&#160; As a non-operator, we are able to diversify our investment exposure by participating in a large number of gross wells, as well as entering into more project areas by partnering with numerous experienced operating partners.&#160; In addition, because we can elect to participate on a well-by-well basis, we believe we have increased flexibility in the timing and amount of our capital expenditures because we are not burdened with various contractual development agreements or a large operating support staff.&#160; Further, we are able to avoid exploratory costs incurred by many oil and gas producers.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	During 2015, we participated in the drilling and completion of 292 gross (18.6 net) wells in the Williston Basin.&#160; At December 31, 2015, we owned working interests in 2,630 gross (204.3 net) producing wells, consisting of 2,628 wells targeting the Bakken and Three Forks formations and two wells targeting other formations.&#160; As of December 31, 2015, we leased approximately 165,908 net acres, all located in the Williston Basin, of which approximately 119,088 net acres were developed.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-TRANSFORM: NONE; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; FONT: 10PT/11.4PT 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	As of December 31, 2015, our proved reserves were 65.3 MMBoe (all of which were in the Williston Basin) as estimated by our third-party independent reservoir engineering firm, Ryder Scott Company, LP.&#160; As of December 31, 2015, 65% of our reserves were classified as proved developed and 87% of our reserves were oil.&#160; The following table provides a summary of certain information regarding our assets:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>

	(1)
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 6PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 9.1PT">
	Represents the average daily production over the three months ended December 31, 2015.
</DIV>

<DIV>
<TABLE ID="F43BBFC5E4834A09984C60CD9D7ADDD2" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 9.1PT">
	(2)
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 9.1PT">
	PV-10 is a non-GAAP financial measure.&#160; For further information and reconciliation to the most directly comparable GAAP measure, see "Item 2. Properties
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	&#8211;
</FONT>
	Reconciliation of PV-10 to Standardized Measure."&#160; The prices used to calculate this measure were $50.28 per barrel of oil (WTI price) and $2.58 per MMBtu of natural gas (Henry Hub price), which prices were then further adjusted for transportation, quality and basis differentials.&#160; The average resulting price used as of December 31, 2015 was $42.03 per barrel of oil and $1.63 per Mcf of natural gas.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 10.25PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	During 2015 commodity prices for crude oil, NGL and natural gas experienced sharp declines, and this downward trend has accelerated further into the first quarter of 2016, with crude oil prices reaching a twelve-year low in February 2016. We have significantly reduced our capital budget for 2016.&#160; We believe that we can enhance the value for our shareholders by maintaining flexibility in choosing drilling locations that may yield the greatest rates of return.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Business Strategy
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 18PT">
	Key elements of our business strategies include:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="7AFA3F58C4F4457B8B374DCD53269400" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Deploy our Capital in a Conservative and Strategic Manner and Review Opportunities to Bolster our Liquidity.
</FONT>
	&#160; In the current industry environment, maintaining liquidity is critical.&#160; Therefore, we will be highly selective in the projects that we fund and will review opportunities to bolster our liquidity and financial position through various means.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="96A65FC2FD61450ABBFB87601E57D82F" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Continue Participation in the Development of Our Existing Properties in the Williston Basin as a Non-Operator.
</FONT>
	&#160; In the current price environment, we believe the best way to develop our acreage is to take a long-term approach and develop our locations with potential for the highest rates of return.&#160; We plan to continue to concentrate our capital expenditures in the Williston Basin, where we believe our current acreage position can provide an attractive return on the capital employed on our multi-year drilling inventory of oil-focused properties.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="141895434C6E447DB91434FFEEDA9DDF" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Diversify Our Risk Through Non-Operated Participation in a Large Number of Bakken and Three Forks Wells
</FONT>
	.&#160; As a non-operator, we seek to diversify our investment and operational risk through participation in a large number of oil wells and with multiple operators.&#160; As of December 31, 2015, we have participated in 2,630 gross (204.3 net) producing wells in the Williston Basin with an average working interest of 7.8% in each gross well, with more than 35 experienced operating partners.&#160; We expect to continue partnering with numerous experienced operators across our leasehold positions.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE ID="C19373AC19774F0CB5DCB4FED107B405" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 36PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 18PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Evaluate and Pursue Value-Enhancing Acquisitions, Joint Ventures and Divestitures.&#160;
</FONT>
	We will continue to monitor the market for strategic acquisitions that we believe could be accretive and enhance shareholder value.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	We generally seek to acquire small lease positions at a significant discount to the contiguous acreage positions typically sought by larger producers.&#160; As part of this strategy, we consider areas that are actively being drilled and permitted and where we have an understanding of the operators and their drilling plans, capital requirements and well economics.&#160; Historically, we have acquired properties by purchasing individual or small groups of leases directly from mineral owners or from landmen or lease brokers, as well as purchasing lease packages in identified project areas controlled by specific operators.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14.4PT">
<TABLE ID="11189BE9AC8B4284B050262E9D8299E7" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 47PX; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; &#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Maintain a Strong Balance Sheet and Proactively Manage to Limit Downside.
</FONT>
	&#160; We strive to remain financially strong, yet flexible, through the prudent management of our balance sheet and active management of commodity price volatility.&#160; Given the low commodity price environment existing at December 31, 2015 and continuing into 2016, Northern intends to preserve liquidity by reducing commitments when available and being more selective on capital deployment.&#160; We employ an active commodity price risk management program to better enable us to execute our business plan over the entire commodity price cycle.&#160; The following table summarizes the oil derivative contracts that we have entered into as of December 31, 2015, by fiscal quarter:
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
